trans-unit.source: Describes a string of characters.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> structure from a unmanaged character string.
The caller needs unmanaged code permission in order to invoke the CharacterBufferRange method.
An unmanaged pointer reference to a character string.
The number of characters in `unsafecharacterString` to use.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> structure from a character array.
The character array.
The character buffer offset to the first character.
The number of characters in `characterArray` to use.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> structure from a character string.
The character string.
The character buffer offset to the first character.
The number of characters in `characterString` to use.
Gets a reference to the character buffer of a string.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference"></xref> value representing the character buffer of a string.
Gets an empty character string.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object whose <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.Length*> is equal to 0.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> objects are equal if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> properties are equal.
The <xref:System.Object> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object.
if o is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
If o is not a object, is returned.

Determines whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> objects are equal if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> properties are equal.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> object.
if value is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
If value is not a object, is returned.
Serves as a hash function for <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref>.
It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the hash code for the current object.
Gets the number of characters in the text source character store.
An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the total number of characters.
Compare two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> strings for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> to compare.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to show the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compare two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> strings for inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange"></xref> to compare.
to show left is equal to right; otherwise, .
